item.title: Further Resources
item.description: You can find further introductory material (tutorials, full courses) for free in the following links: R by Data Carpentry R manuals from CRAN About Markdown, from Learn X in Y minutes R basics, from from Learn X in Y minutes R basics and Statistics and R, from Harvard University on edX

item.title: Schedule
item.description: We meet every Wednesday @10am for one-hour sessions listed below. Tutorials will contain extra exercises to practice on your own time. Besides formal meeting times, each of the instructors will hold weekly office hours in Zoom in which they will be available to help with the tutorials or other R questions you may have. Keep an eye out on Slack for a link to Zoom meetings. Sections Topic Content summary By Date How R works R/RStudio, objects, manipulate data Ernesto Bonadies April 29 Flow control packages, loops, if/else, functions Lee Dietterich May 6 Graphics baseR, gpplot2 Tauana Cunha May 13 Statistical analysis anova, linear models, ordination Bruno de Medeiros May 20 Office Hours Lee Dietterich - every Monday @3pm

item.title: Example Tutorial R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
